intro: Eriocaulon kannurense, commonly known as the narrow-leaved marsh plant, is a species of flowering plant in the family Eriocaulaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia, particularly found in wetlands and marshy areas. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves that are often covered in fine, silky hairs. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically clustered in dense spikes. Eriocaulon kannurense plays a role in wetland ecosystems by contributing to soil stabilization and providing habitat for various microorganisms.
